conversations.content: The Leaders of the Twelve Wyrmclans of Hinomoto: Though united in their aim to govern their land, divided are their ambitions, each a worthy rival vying for the gloried seat of shogun.
Two such clan leaders, having just returned from a journey to spread good fortune among other nations, now answer a summons to the homestead of Ieyasu; leader of the Boar Clan.
The Eastern Island Nation of Hinomoto Estate of Ieyasu; Leader of the Boar Clan
An express invitation of this nature begets business most vital, I must imagine?
Nobunaga; Leader of the Horse Clan
Indeed. I would not have bade you visit otherwise.
Ieyasu; Leader of the Boar Clan
What's your angle here, gathering three Wyrmclan leaders under one roof?
Mitsuhide; Leader of the Mouse Clan
We gonna get a head start on this whole fight for succession, maybe?
...Ah, thank you, this tea is exquisite. Wait...are we just here for tea?!
I thought a discussion over tea most fitting for what I'd like to address today.
Pray tell me, fellow clan leaders: What qualities define an apt ruler?
A fascinating question indeed—and one I would be delighted to answer!
By all means, Nobunaga. The floor is yours.
It's simple, really. What a ruler needs... is the strength to guide her people!
To inspire hopes and dreams in the people, and walk forward together with them. For a nation cannot prosper unless its people grow.
Sage words indeed.
And you, Ieyasu? Since you raised the question, you ought to answer as well.
Very well. What I deem necessary for a leader...is unwavering righteousness.
Without justice and honor in your heart, you risk treading down the wrong path.
Might you be trying to suggest that I am a fool of a ruler who races forth recklessly?
Perish the thought. It is no more than a difference in where our priorities lie.
*sigh* Yeah, yeah, you're both admirable. Everyone is sooo very surprised.
Do not be so insipid, Mitsuhide. You are a clan leader as well, are you not?
I would hear your opinion as well. Your perspective is valued here.
＂What makes an apt ruler,＂ huh? Well...
Well...?
Chilling out.
...Pardon?
If you're too stiff you'll eventually snap. That's why you've gotta chill out every once in a while. ...Or ALL the while. Especially if you're ruling over folks.
So if you follow that thinking to its logical conclusion, a laid-back ruler makes for a laid-back domain. Peace and tranquility and all that, y'know?
Er, well, I suppose I can follow the thread of your logic...
Don't be fooled, Ieyasu. She's only trying to justify her own behavior.
You wound me. I'm just giving you my opinion here.
Besides, becoming shogun is the last thing on my mind. I've got a good thing going right now, and I'm not about to mess it up.
Surely you jest!
No fooling. Being responsible for all of Hinomoto really ain't my style.
If I somehow ended up with the job...I'd consider it. But we've already got qualified folks out there like you itching to handle it.
Chilling out in my own domain sounds a lot more my speed.
I suppose it does. Have you no aspirations whatsoever, though?
The only thing I aspire to do is kick back, relax, and enjoy this ride we call life.
You sound quite certain.
...Incidentally, I think it's about time you tell us what you're really getting at here, Ieyasu.
You wanna ask us about something else, right? About, oh, I dunno... The Alberian prince, maybe?
I'm afraid you'll have to elaborate.
We had just gotten back from our journey to spread fortune when you first invited us here.
Then you launched into asking us what we think is necessary for a person to be a good ruler.
You know who else is a ruler? The prince of Alberia.
Basically, you were hoping our chat would shed some light on the current state of Alberia. Am I right, or am I right?
...You're as sharp as ever. It was pointless to employ smoke and mirrors with you.
Why did you not state your intent from the very beginning, Ieyasu?
You were concerned about how it would look, right? A Wyrmclan leader backing a foreign nation... It'd be pretty easy to use that as a smear tactic against you.
Aha ha. It's nothing so grave. You might say I was simply...＂covering my bases,＂ as I believe the saying goes.
You're a wily one, Ieyasu. Still, can't say I'm complaining about sharing travel stories over a nice cup of tea.
Alberia was a pretty lively place. Lots'a real characters there. That said...
There's something about that prince that's bugging me.
Oh?
What, really? You showed no signs of discontent.
Well, it didn't have anything to do with the fortune-spreading, y'know? It's just a, I don't know...a personal interest.
I can't help wondering what might happen if I meddle a bit.
Hm?
In any case, my curiosity's gotten the better of me, so on that note... I'm headed off to Alberia. You guys have fun with everything here.
Alberia?! Now?!
Yep. Make up a good excuse for me if Chitose comes calling, Nobunaga. Byeee!
Hey! Wait, you can't just—*sigh* Aaand she's off on yet another flight of fancy.
She's been different ever since she became a Wyrmclan leader.
Indeed. Honestly, that Mitsuhide... What could she possibly want to do in Alberia?
Now, let's see... How shall I conquer this castle?
Zzz...
Ya know, a guy can't help but wonder— is it still technically a ＂nap＂ if yer THAT dead to the world?
Aren't the Twelve Wyrmclan leaders supposed to be, like, the cream of the Hinomoto crop?
Was it truly wise to show her in simply because she asserted that this would make an ＂excellent napping spot＂?
As long as she's comfortable, I suppose it's fine.
Zzz...zzzzz... Oh, bed... You've always been there for me...
＂Fine,＂ you say? Truly?
Er... Probably...?
Mrmrm... This is heavenly...
She's got a point—it's PERFECT napping weather! Get your sleep on, girl!
Hear me!
Hinomotoan Samurai Yachiyo
All right, throw up your dukes!
Yachiyo?! I thought you were out hunting fiends!
I was, but when I caught wind that one'a the leaders of the Twelve Wyrmclans blew into town, I made like a banana and split!
Talk about being committed to the cause! Still, Mitsuhide's kind of a big deal in Hinomoto. I'm not sure she'd accept a challenge like—
A duel? Sure.
Wait, for real?!
Hah! Come on then, let's dance!
Wait, you're gonna duel NOW? What the heck is going on?!
...Perhaps it is just my imagination, but the number of slumbering bodies around the castle seems to be on the rise.
Zzz...
Even Yachiyo, hm? For her to be here rather than dashing about making brazen challenges is unusual indeed.
*yawn* Nah, actually, this IS a duel.
How so, Notte?
So, Yachiyo challenged Mitsuhide to a duel, right?
Haaaaah!
Hold up, time out, time out. You sure you should duel with that blade? It's pretty nicked, isn't it?
Well I'll be! Must'a happened when I was boppin' those fiends...
But you needn't worry! A nick or two won't impede my performance in the slightest!
Seriously? Bit of a shame to use a damaged weapon in a duel you want to win, huh?
Don't you want us to go at each other with everything we've got?
W-well, when you put it that way...
I'm not going to run or hide. Go sharpen your blade.
And in the meantime...how about we have a duel by MY rules?
So, they're dueling to see who can nap the longest...?
A-yuuup. Oh, but I'm not dueling. I just got swept up in the sleepy mood and figured I'd catch a few winks. *yawn*
Mm... Oh, confound it. Ever the early bird...
All right, Mitsuhide, let's take this from the top!
*yawn* Sure thing. Come at me... as many times...as you want...
This is absurd. Mitsuhide, surely you have more important pursuits than sleeping your life away?
Forgive my impertinence, but I think you go too far in your pursuit of ＂chilling out＂—
How about you chill out a bit yourself, Cleo?
...Did you hear a word I just said?
You're always so serious. I've been wishing we could talk more casually.
You were fussing over me 'cause I'm an honored guest from a foreign land, right?
Well...
Wouldn't it be nice to put all the formalities aside and just talk, girl to girl?
I really think fostering a mutual understanding between nations is key to establishing good relations. You feel me?
Very well. Your words hold merit. As long as we don't tarry too long, I will join you.
Grrrrreat. Time for some group chilling!
After all, there are some things you just can't talk about if you're stuck being stiff and formal...
Hey, there you are, Euden! Is it dinnertime?
Just about. We were a bit late getting back from fiend hunting. Sorry about that.
*sigh* Well, aren't you a model prince, always breaking his back for the sake of the people.
Why do you go to so much effort?
Why? I should think it's obvious. To take care of my people and my friends.
A real Charitable Charles, aren't you? Still, I dunno, don't you ever feel like...
Like YOU don't even factor into the equation? Doesn't that feel empty?
Huh...?
Meh, we'll just leave it at that. Anyway, this kingdom's nice.
Things in the surrounding area are a little dicey, but all the people you've rallied here seem like good-hearted folks.
Your castle's comfortable, the food's four-star, and most importantly, the beds are a premier gateway to slumberland.
Well, I'm glad you find the kingdom to your liking.
I don't just like it—I love it. So, how about you give it to me?
...What?
I mean, I think it'd be best for everyone if I ran things around here, yeah?
Hate to break it to ya, Euden, but we're with Mitsuhide on this one.
Sorry, pal.
We support Mitsuhide.
What?! What's going on here, Mitsuhide?!
Oh, you know. Your allies are just plotting an uprising with me.
An uprising?!
An uprising?!
Euden! What's all this commotion?
Hey, perfect timing. We were all just about to incite an uprising against Euden.
Are you in?
You're doing WHAT?! Don't be daft! Have you taken leave of your senses?!
My thinker's workin' just fine, and we're all ready to tangle.
True that. We're dead serious.
This is unconscionable.
Ninja in Service to Euden Jurota
That you would use honeyed words to bewitch His Majesty's comrades and foment an unjust rebellion...
Such wanton villainy must be quelled, even if the perpetrator is the leader of a Wyrmclan.
What're you gonna do about it, then?
I'll have your head. Right here, right now.
Calm yourself, Jurota!
No. As your vassal, he's right to be incensed. You could stand to learn a lesson about when to be firm.
Or maybe you've yet to truly realize that you're about to lose your precious castle?
What are you trying to do here, Mitsuhide?
Occupy your kingdom.
I've got no interest in becoming shogun of Hinomoto. Defeating all the other leaders of the Wyrmclans sounds like a hassle and a half.
So I figure it's way faster to just steal someone else's kingdom and become the boss that way. Best of all, I'll have free rein—or rather, ＂reign＂—to do as I please.
That's why I decided I'd take your castle and have your allies fall in line behind me.
No. You'll have neither my friends nor my castle.
I can't stop my friends from leaving me if that's what they wish. I have no right.
But if you think you're going to take things from me by force, you're in for a rude awakening.
Then you're going to fight me and your seditious pals?
I can tell from your expression that you're wondering how you can resolve this without bloodshed.
*sigh* I reiterate: you're too soft. But I ALSO think fighting's a pain, so how about we play a game instead?
Such as?
A little something I like to call ＂Uprising.＂
I've never heard of any such game.
Naturally, considering I devised it myself. The rules are simple.
Over a period of three days, whichever of us acts for someone else first is the loser.
In other words, if you make a slacker like me do something for someone else, you win.
Oh, and if we come to a draw, I win by default.
Preposterous! You have a massive advantage in a game like that!
Obvi. I made the game, duh. So, are you in?
...You're on.
Are you sure about this, Your Highness?!
If there's a way to solve this without fighting, I'm going to do it.
If I've alienated my friends, it's because of my own failings.
And that's why I don't want to fight them. Even if they ARE rebelling against me.
There's no take-backs on this, you know.
Of course.
Then the game will begin tomorrow. Let's make it a niiice, relaxing, enjoyable game of Uprising!
Euden, I've confirmed the extent of Mitsuhide's influence.
About half of the people in the castle have already thrown their support behind her.
I see...
I beg you not to lose heart, Your Highness.
Yeah...you're right. Sorry. And thank you. Okay, let's get the strategy meeting started.
Is this truly wise? I feel as though we're playing right into the enemy's hands.
This is a battle to protect my comrades. Trap or no, I will not turn tail and run.
Understood. Then, I would propose a certain strategy...
The next day, the game of Uprising begins. Euden's side makes its move...
Zzz...
All right, let's begin the operation.
Yes. I WILL succeed in rousing Mitsuhide.
Elisanne will call out, and Mitsuhide will awaken...
Meaning that we'll be able to assert that she has acted for Elisanne, who wishes for her to wake up.
Mitsuhide, wake up!
Zzz...
WAKE UP, MITSUHIDE! WAKE UP! WAKE UP WAKE UP WAKE UP!
Zzz...
*sigh* Unbelievable. I'm screaming directly in her ear, and she's not waking...
No, you put up a good fight, Elisanne. Her affinity for slumber is fearsome indeed.
As long as she's asleep, that gives us time to come up with a Plan B. Let's get thinking.
Indeed. We may as well take advantage of this opportunity.
How long is she going to sleep for?!
D-don't tell me she's planning to sleep the entire day away...
She'll have to wake up and eat eventually. Let's go check on her again.
There's a mound on the bed. I guess she's sleeping after all?
Did you see that?! Movement! She's—
Mmm, Cleo's bread rolls and cake are sublime!
It's important to always build a stockpile of food in bed. That way, you don't have to budge an inch to chow down!
What?! What kind of sedentary trickery—?!
I can sense her iron will to never leave bed. Which is quite the problem...
Yeah. How can we get a person who won't even get out of bed to do someone else a favor?
(Oho ho ho. So naive. You have no idea how firm, how unshakable my resolve is.)
(Struggle, Euden. I want to see just how far you'll go.)
Uprising: A simple game with dire stakes. Its only rule? Abandon all pretense.
In indolence, justice! In selflessness, defeat! To the ＂chill＂ go the spoils!
Considered from another perspective, kindness and advantage share an inverse relationship in this game of do-or-do-not.
Mitsuhide's side makes their move...
*sniffle*
(Mitsuhide? Unusual to see her out of bed. Maybe this could be my chance to... Wait, what's she...?)
Bonnie... Bonnie, where are you...? *sob*
(Hmm... She's running the Uprising game, but she looks awfully distraught... Surely it'd be okay for me to ask her what's up.)
Mitsuhide, what's wrong?
Oh, Euden...  I've lost Bonnie. *sniffle*
Who's Bonnie?
My mouse friend. She usually rides around on my head.
Ah, right. And when did she disappear?
She was gone when I woke up this afternoon. Oh, whatever should I do? If she were to get lost in the woods and become some fiend's dinner, I...!
Calm down, Mitsuhide. I'll hel—
Euden, it's a trap!
You'd lose the game if you helped her look for the mouse.
And Mitsuhide, your mouse is sleeping comfortably in your room, isn't she?
Mice—I mean, rats! I was so close.
WHAT?! Wait, so those tears...
As crocodile as they come. I almost had you, too.
My victory's only a matter of time, y'know. *yawn* Guess it's back to the drawing— napping?—board for me. Gooood luck!
Thank you, Jurota. You're a lifesaver.
Think nothing of it. But you must remain vigilant, Your Highness. Mitsuhide is a cunning opponent.
She even went to the trouble of winning over the people of the Halidom in preparation. Do not be fooled by her recumbent facade.
(Come to think of it, roping half the folks in the castle into her schemes would be a lot of trouble, so why would Mitsuhide...?)
(There had to have been an easier way to steal the kingdom if she REALLY wanted to do it. Why would she go this far with her Uprising game?)
Final Day of the Uprising Game
You hangin' in there all right, Euden?
I'm getting by, I suppose.
Remember, if you don't get me to do something for someone else today...
I'll lose the game. I know. But it's not over until it's over.
Honestly, I didn't think you'd tough it out for this long. You're made of sturdy stuff.
(That being said, kinda feels like we're coming right down to the wire here.)
(They saw right through my ＂boo-hoo, I can't find Bonnie＂ strategy...)
(Buuuut, I wonder what he would do if I collapsed right here, hacking and cou—)
Euden, this is bad! A horde of fiends has attacked the village beyond the forest!
What?!
Euden, the Imperial Army is advancing on a town to the north! They number over two hundred!
No... No, not now!
This isn't good. If the prince has to divide his forces, I'm not sure either group would be sufficient to contend with these threats.
Elisanne, Jurota: You two take the others and head to the town up north. I'll shapeshift and handle the fiends!
You can't fight alone! There are too many of them, and—
Ah-ah-ah. The Uprising game isn't over yet.
You didn't forget the rules, did you? If you act to help someone, you lose.
What are you babbling about at a time like this?! People could be in actual danger!
It's a question of what's important to you.
Your own circumstances, or other people's. Which one is it, Euden?
...Elly, Jurota, you take the others and go. I'll handle the fiends.
At least let me accompany you! Even with your power of shapeshifting, going alone is tantamount to suicide!
It'll be fine. Believe in me. Now hurry up and go!
So you've made your choice, huh?
I guess we can call the game a wrap. Score 1 for Mitsuhide, 0 for—
Wrong. I'm not doing this for others. I'm doing it for me.
If I don't go right now, I, the leader of New Alberia, will be the one to regret it!
Everyone, please...listen to me. I want you to help me do this!
I realize how ridiculous it is for me to ask you to indulge me when you've already declared your allegiance to Mitsuhide.
But please! Help me to protect the people!
...Sorry, Mitsuhide. Turns out there ain't nobody more fit to be our leader what for him after all.
Honestly, I wish you'd lean on us like this all the time.
If you're goin' out there, there's no way we can just sit around twiddlin' our bowstrings.
Thank you all! Let's go!
Yeah!
Huh, I didn't see this coming. Touché, Prince. Touché.
Are you quite sure it's all right for you to sit this one out?
Oh, YOU'RE here? Welp, looks like I'm gonna have to go along too, aren't I?
I would imagine your uprising is far past the point of ending in a happily-ever-after.
Yeah, yeah, I know. Circumstances being what they are, I'll let you handle this, Daikokuten.
As you command!
Meh. He scored one on me, so the least I can do is throw the guy a bone.
*pant* Is there no end to these fiends?
We need to hurry and finish them off before they do permanent damage to the village!
Taaake this! A power most divine!
That attack... Daikokuten?!
Allow me to spare you an unhappy ending.
Vile fiends, wreak not your wanton destruction! In grace shall you perish!
I am one of the twelve great dragons, Daikokuten! Have at you! Hyaaah!
We can't let this opening go to waste! Follow Daikokuten, everyone!
The following day...
Zzz...
You there, Mitsuhide?
*yawn* So, you finally decide what to do with your traitors?
Exile? Or maybe you'll cut our heads off and stick 'em on pikes to deter future mutineers?
Yeah, I made a decision—but nothing so grave. I'm going to forgive them.
Whoa. Y'know, there's being a softie, and then there's...whatever you are.
Even if it was only a one-time fluke, you're really going to pardon your allies for betraying you? Just like that?
They all threw their weight behind you for my sake, didn't they?
Uh, what? How could you possibly spin it so that an uprising is in FAVOR of the guy being rised-up against?
Because it wasn't a real uprising. It was the Uprising game.
And seeing that it's a game, it's got rules. Like ＂act selflessly, and you lose.＂
That means the inverse is true: The game rewards you for thinking about yourself.
The only reason why my friends participated was to send me a message that it's okay to live my life for my own sake, too. Am I wrong?
Ding ding ding. You're as sharp as you are faithful to your pals.
There IS one thing I still need to mull over, though. I've never felt that I was smothering my own desires.
But if that's how it came across, then I'd like to rely on others more, and not hesitate to voice my own wants and needs.
And then everyone lives happily ever after, huh? Good thing I incited that uprising! You're welcome! Welp, it's back to sleep for me then, so good nigh—
I haven't come to a verdict on you yet, Mitsuhide.
...Mice. And here I thought you'd let it slide.
What were you REALLY trying to do?
I told you, didn't I? I wanted to occupy your kingdom.
If that were true, surely you wouldn't have come alone.
Maybe it was a trap to get you to let your guard down.
Then it would've just been faster for you to kill me while my guard was down.
Why would you—someone so famously averse to putting in effort—go to all the trouble of laying the groundwork you did?
I'll tell you why: because your goal was never actually to occupy the kingdom, but to play the Uprising game itself.
I really hadn't pegged you as being this perceptive. Bravo.
What I don't understand is WHY you wanted to play the game.
I can't come to a verdict on you if I don't have a full picture of the situation.
Game's over, so I guess there's no harm in letting it slip. My reason was simple.
It made me angry to see you breaking your back for other people.
It made you ANGRY?
Ooh, yeah, hold that pose. The look on your face is priceless. I'm serious about the anger, though.
Why did you feel like that?
Because living only to serve others makes you lose sight of yourself. I figured you were on your way to becoming an empty shell—like I was, a long time ago.
I'm not sure I follow.
It'll be hard for you to picture, I'm sure, but I used to be a real goody two-shoes.
Huh.
Don't believe me, do you? Still, it's the truth.
I was as mousy as they come. Unreliable. All I ever did was make others worry. Eventually, my family got together and educated me on how to be a good leader.
Everything I did was for my parents— for my family. I pushed myself so hard that I even made a soulpact.
But the cost of a soulpact is...
It's all good. I wouldn't be the person I am now if I hadn't become a Wyrmclan leader.
But anyway, once I made that pact, I realized I couldn't keep giving my life away in service of others.
We've all only got one chance at this life. It was then that I decided to forge my own path.
And when I looked at you, it made me remember my past—my days spent as an empty husk. I'll be honest, it set me off. That's why I decided to meddle a little.
That's the whole truth. Long story short, you were nothing more than a stand-in for my own deep-seated trauma. Knowing that, what's your verdict?
Let your heart be your guide.
That's exactly what I intend to do.
I'll overlook what you've done.
Uh, why?
Because you made me realize that I shouldn't forget to live for myself as well.
My friends' hearts were aching for me. The Uprising game is what made me realize that.
And it's only because of your insight that I've been inspired to change.
So you're saying you'll try to live a little more selfishly than you do now, eh? Greedy, this one.
But y'know what? I can chill with that. That's how life ought to be.
Even a prince is a person before he puts his crown on every morning. You've got every right to live for yourself.
I agree. Thanks for making me realize that, Mitsuhide.
And on that note, I'm gonna partake of your hospitality here a liiittle bit longer.
Y-you are?!
I thought you said you'd let bygones be bygones. After all, we DID just finish talking about living selfishly and all that.
Now, if you'll excuse me, naptime awaits. Looking forward to chilling out together, Euden.
